message_1:
Apply predicate logic to determine whether the following statement is true or false:

"All prime numbers are odd."

p(x): x is a prime number
q(x): x is an odd number

∀x(p(x) → q(x)) 

Is the above statement true or false?
message_2:
The statement "All prime numbers are odd" is false.

The given statement can be represented in predicate logic as:

∀x(p(x) → q(x))

However, the prime number 2 is an exception, as it is the only even prime number. Since 2 is a prime number and it is not odd, the statement is false.
